title: spack ignores version if it is not checksummed
body:
I have the following in `~/.spack/packages.py`:
```python
packages:
    cmake:
        version: [3.1.0]
```
However, spack quietly ignores it
```bash
$ spack spec -I cmake
...
Concretized
--------------------------------
     cmake@3.6.1%gcc@6.2.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64
         ^ncurses@6.0%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64
         ^openssl@1.0.2j%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64
             ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64

$ spack install -v --fake cmake
==> Installing cmake
==> Installing ncurses
==> Building ncurses [Package]
==> Successfully installed ncurses
  Fetch: .  Build: 0.05s.  Total: 0.05s.
[+] /home/xap/code/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/ncurses-6.0-7abjubw7hxme3k7dufbfuc2jw3b2tajv
==> Installing openssl
==> Installing zlib
==> Building zlib [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Successfully installed zlib
  Fetch: .  Build: 0.05s.  Total: 0.05s.
[+] /home/xap/code/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/zlib-1.2.8-ybm75pptqd3rhst5z73hbaqmkhbdqvpn
==> Building openssl [Package]
==> Successfully installed openssl
  Fetch: .  Build: 0.06s.  Total: 0.06s.
[+] /home/xap/code/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/openssl-1.0.2j-zikexdynkn4gigubc62d6fnq6rmf4wm7
==> Building cmake [Package]
==> Successfully installed cmake
  Fetch: .  Build: 0.09s.  Total: 0.09s.
[+] /home/xap/code/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/cmake-3.6.1-nyaqkijdsnrnb5j3ecrowtul6u3m7u7f
```
If I explicitly add 3.1.0 checsum 
```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/package.py
index 93bdb72..d0f64d7 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/package.py
@@ -39,6 +39,7 @@ class Cmake(Package):
     version('3.4.3',    '4cb3ff35b2472aae70f542116d616e63')
     version('3.4.0',    'cd3034e0a44256a0917e254167217fc8')
     version('3.3.1',    '52638576f4e1e621fed6c3410d3a1b12')
+    version('3.1.0',    '188eb7dc9b1b82b363bc51c0d3f1d461')
     version('3.0.2',    'db4c687a31444a929d2fdc36c4dfb95f')
     version('2.8.10.2', '097278785da7182ec0aea8769d06860c')
```
the behaviour changes to the expected one
```bash
$ spack spec -I cmake
Concretized
--------------------------------
[+]  cmake@3.1.0%gcc@6.2.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64
[+]      ^ncurses@6.0%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64
[+]      ^openssl@1.0.2j%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64
[+]          ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-fedora24-x86_64

$ spack install -v --fake cmake
==> cmake is already installed in /home/xap/code/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/cmake-3.1.0-gyssgl5imzkcrbyjkzhx7yxuenwbfhth
```

It looks as a bug with a clear workaround, i.e. one should add used versions checksums.
